alert.note: Alert for Chase; Elk; Greenwood; Montgomery; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 12:17AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Elk, Wilson, northern Montgomery, southeastern Chase, Woodson and Greenwood Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1217 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles west of Hamilton to 5 miles northeast of Elk City. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Neodesha, Fredonia, Yates Center, Madison, Altoona, Elk City, Toronto, Hamilton, Buffalo, Fall River, Neosho Falls, Sycamore, Benedict, Climax, Virgil, New Albany, Coyville, Eureka City Lake and Buxton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Chase; Elk; Greenwood; Montgomery; Wilson; Woodson
